title: Exceptional practice
body: During the pandemic I have had to call the Satis House Practice on many occasions.  I have been caring for my elderly Mother and the kindness and support we have received from everyone at Satis House has been outstanding.  I can't thank them enough they are all wonderful people.

title: Great service
body: Thank you for contacting me so promptly. Very helpful receptionist and very helpful GP. I love the new queuing system where you phone back so I do not have to hold on. Great idea

title: Good quality practice
body:
I have recently had to contact the surgery several times recently and each time my query was dealt with efficiently and professionally with staff going the extra mile. 
Would,and I do, often recommend this surgery and it’s staff to others.

title: Diabetic eye test
body:
Arrived on time found dept closed. Gentleman said dept closed but perhaps it had moved. After having to go around building completely he took me to a different building. Because I have walking difficulties it took some time and 
I was told I was late.
The eye clinic was not where the instructions said it was apparently it had moved. I was not told of this change in fact no signs were showing directing me to correct area. This resulted in me suffering pain in my legs due to the amount of walking I had to do. Can you ensure adequate signage is in position in future.
Patrick McCann.

title: Great caring service in the ED Department
body:
I was struggling to breath, I was sat in a booth waiting my turn, when a Dr walked past looked at me and removed my mask, I just gave the thumbs up! He saw his patient and then took me in his room and listened to me. I was then taken to a another room where I was put on a nebuliser and further treatment commenced. All the time I was there I was made to feel comfortable and reassured. The department was clean and tidy and I felt completely safe from COVID-19.
What great care I received whilst my husband sat in the car waiting!

readBy.name: Northern Lincolnshire and Goole NHS Foundation Trust

title: Doing a great job in difficult times
body:
Moved my mom to this surgery and have to give credit where its due, we are very pleased. The receptionist staff are superb, efficient, caring and very helpful in everything I have asked of them. Best service. Thank you so much to them.
Experience of Doctors appointment was also very good and thorough investigations undertaken.
One small downside would be long wait for a physio service via Royal Ortho. Could do with being able to use a private practice for nhs like Bromsgrove/Worcester do. 10 out of 10 in our book.

author: Midgill06
title: The birth of my baby
body:
I had a planned c section at ninewells hospital in Dundee. Whilst the midwives on the whole were lovely as were the midwife care assistants I had an overall negative experience. I felt the medical team were really quite awful in the way they acted and their bedside manner. I have so many questions I now want to ask and things I want to go over and would like to know how I can go about this?  
I don’t even know the name of the person who delivered my baby as 5 different people came to introduce themselves as the person who was doing it. My birth preferences were denied by one of the medical team and then they didn’t even come in for the birth anyway. I felt passed from pillar to post and the experience has taken me a while to get over. I would like to know how I can talk to Ninewells about my experience.

author: mercurykc88
title: Lack of information
body: I had my baby in November and although my experience with staff and care was excellent when my baby was born, in the run up to my planned c-section I received absolutely no information regarding my operation to the point where I didn't even have it on paper the date or time I had to attend. The only information or pre-op assessment I received was about covid and a covid test. I had to phone numerous people off my own back and nobody seemed to find it unusual I had no information. The whole situation was very stressful and angered me greatly. When I arrived in hospital the care was amazing and I have no complaints. I had an idea of what to expect but only because I used the internet to find information to help prepare me. This is not acceptable for women about to give birth via a planned section and I would be interested to know if this has just happened to me or if covid has caused pre-op care for women to slip dramatically.

author: giftqn47
title: Fabulous support to parents and children
body:
Great team at Ward 1c Queen Elizabeth children’s hospital Glasgow, fabulous support to parents and children.  
Recently started offering teas/coffees breakfast, snacks to patients. What a wonderful service

author: limapq74
title: Staff kept me informed
body: My relative was in AMU last month. The sister and staff kept me informed and even though the restrictions were difficult I felt confident that he was in a safe place. Thank you so much he is at home now and District Nurses looking after him well 😊

readBy.name: Western Health and Social Care Trust

author: BHMM201017
title: My Daughters hospital admission
body:
My daughter is 3 years old and when we woke up one morning we couldn’t get her to wake up, it was 7am and she’s normally up and eating breakfast at 5am.  
I phoned NHS24 who referred us to A& E at St Johns hospital, the care she received was fantastic. Her BM had dropped to 2.1 but Matt (a junior doctor, I’m sure?) worked very quickly to ensure she received the treatments she needed and explained everything that was going on in detail to me and answered any questions I had without making me feel like we were holding him back from other jobs, especially when the department was so busy. We were quickly treated and moved up to the children’s ward and were met by Marianne, and the other nurses (Sorry, I can’t remember the other names!!).  
Marianne chatted away to my daughter and commented on her nail polish, and made her feel at ease the full duration of our stay, but most importantly introduced her to Laura, who she still refers to as the Toy Doctor. I have ulcerative colitis and often spend time in the hospital either for overnight stays or for outpatient appointments, and will be going for a big operation this year and my daughter can find this very distressing and feels the hospital in a negative place but after her experience of having a “sleepover at the hospital” she now realises that the hospital is nothing to worry about and now expects there to be a fantastic Toy Doctor on standby after my op! !  
I am so thankful to all of the staff who cared for her, especially Marianne, because if we ever need the children’s ward again I know that my girls will be in the safest hands. The team are very lucky to have a newly qualified nurse who is so fantastic at making her patients and their families feel relaxed whilst also making sure they have everything they need. We are also extremely thankful for Laura who made her stay more child friendly and ensured that she had access to plenty of activities to keep her busy and distracted from the BM checks!  
Since coming home, she has been telling all of our family and friends how cool the hospital is and how Laura and Marianne, “her doctors”, were so kind to her and how they even looked after all the babies whilst looking after her. She won’t always remember her stay, but her Dad and I will and we are so thankful that it was such a positive experience for us all, despite her being unwell, but we will always remember the outstanding level of care we received. Thank you to everyone who looked after her, and to Dr Pitel for continuing her care after her discharge. We are so lucky to have such an amazing paediatric team close by. Thank you again! !

author: schizoaffectivegirl
title: Bad experiences at A&E with mental health.
body:
In 2020 I was very very distressed. I have been hearing voices that was telling me to hurt someone who was very close to me. I wasn't coping with that. I was acutely suicidal, and I hated myself so much that I thought it was absolutely necessary that I need to kill myself first before I do that to anybody else.  
I was living with my brother at the time who was so worried because of just how distressed I was. Him and my sister in law had to take turns to keep an eye on me 24/7 and they were not coping with the level of distress I was experiencing, they couldn't keep me safe nor other people's safety.  
Eventually they took me to A&E, we waited for hours. When we finally saw someone and I told them what I was going through I was told I was making it up. I was accused of lying and just making up symptoms to get away with things. The mental health worker that assessed me explicitly told me that I need to be careful in what I'm saying, and they would report me to the police and I will be arrested because I didn't have anything mentally wrong with me and I will be responsible. Having already feel so horrible about myself due to everything I was experiencing, being told that made things so much worse. At that point I truly believed that I was the problem, that I need to be gone before I do any damage to anybody else and I believed that I just didn't deserve anyone to care and the mental health workers who saw me that night confirmed that.  
My brother was lost. He was frustrated. They just thrown us out even though under those circumstances I really shouldn't have been allowed to leave A&E whilst I was clearly a risk to myself and to others. I got to a stage asking for help, talking about psychotic experiences that I couldn't understand and I was really distressed of experiencing, then to be told by mental health professionals that I was lying, or being dramatic it is absurd. That experience scarred me, and it means that in the years to come I became much more withdrawn and really struggled with talking about my experiences in the fear of not being believed again.  
Few days later after that attendance at A&E I was sectioned. I attempted suicide. If someone have probably listened and just supported correctly earlier, things probably wouldn't escalate to that point. I could have lost my life. I could have hurt other people. But it was preventable if I was given at least a level of understanding and the right support.

readBy.name: Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2021)

title: left feeling unsure and unsafe
body: Found the reception staff and nurse to be helpful, concerned & informative. When after 8 weeks I finally got to see a doctor their manner was abrupt and irritable. I left my appointment feeling that I'd been poorly informed re the prognosis I'd been given (as i stopped asking questions re what i was being told because it was made pretty clear that they were unwelcome), and therefore unsure that it was well thought through, considered and safe; because of the inappropriate  and unprofessional behaviour I had been exposed to. I have since changed practices.

title: Not improving
body:
Although the staff are all friendly and professional, this surgery's appointment availabilty for patients is getting worse. For some time there was a 2 week wait for an appointment which in itself is not that great. When there were 2 full time doctor's who were willing to see patients it was a 5 day maximum wait. I have been with this surger for 25+ years so know this.

Ever since March 2021 the waiting time to see a doctor has now increased to more than 3 weeks!! There are rarely any apppointments available using the app so you have to call in to get an appointment. This is not accepatble. Something has changed to increase the waiting time and the only excuse they have is that more people are suddenly making appointments. This didn't happen throughout the pandemic and now suddenly there has been a surge in pateints? Perhaps if the doctors actually worked full time or worked maybe in the morning and afternoon instead of a few days a week in the morning/afternoon it would make a diffference, but the seem to be more interested in saving money. Very disappointing.

title: Treated with respect
body: I have just visited A&E after a minor injury last night. All the staff were absolutely lovely. Full of grace and humour in the face of immense difficulty. I was treated with compassion, warmth and respect. Reminded me why I love the NHS (and I work in the NHS). Thank you

author: PQuinn
title: Insufficient NHS support
body:
I am 34 years old. Over the last few years I have been left with no option but to receive treatment privately due to the lack of treatment and diagnosis from my practice.  
Issue 1.  
I had some serious knee pain following a football injury. On visiting my gp at my local practice I was given pain medication and physio treatment. This knee pain went on all through physio treatment and I was offered nothing more that physio and pain relief. My knee would give in on me, doing basic activities such as walking. It was then I have to take the descision and go private. I was immediately reffered to a specialist who reffered me for an MRI and physio treatment. The MRI showed that I had damage to my miniscus. Surgery was approved and during keyhole surgery they found that my tendon was torn in the centre, therefore my knee was opened up and appropriate surgery was given. If I had not went private I firmly believe I would have been left with irreversible damage, with the impression that only pain relief was the answer. I'm have made a full recovery after surgery.  
Issue 2. I have had ongoing back problems for years after an incident in the forces, and each time I seen a GP I only ever received pain relief. The pain over the years has progressively worsened again I was given pain relief and physio through my GP. This pain has continued to worsen and and due to it being near impossible to get through to my practice over the phone due to their completely insufficient telephone line, I again had to go private. I first tried chiropractic treatment which gave me temporary relief. As it was only temporary and running into the thousands I then reached out to a specialist privately. I again was immediately reffered to a physio and an for an MRI scan. The physio treated me as normal with the inclusion of electro accupuncture. The physio treatment as before did not provide much more progress in my increasing and completely immobilising back pain. The MRI showed signs of a possible historic disk split with scarring and degeneration of the disc, irreversible damage that could have been treated better in the past. I recall on one occasion calling 999 as in one instance I collapsed to the floor in pain and could not move anything other than my arms without nearly passing out in pain. Because I had no symptoms of covid and had a history of back pain, The operator told me to hang up and call nhs 24. I waited 40 min on hold until my battery died at which point I lay on my livingroom floor completely immobilised with no way of getting help. I lay there for 1 hr before I was able to drag myself to a phone charger and call my fiancee. With the results of my MRI I was reffered to a pain specialist and received an epidural. To no effect. I since been back to my GP and again only pain relief was given. 2 days later I was in hospital due to being in so much pain I have been completely immobilised. Again only pain relief was given. In hospital along with co-codamol and a pain patch I had already taken, I was given morphine, naproxen and a tramadol, and relevant tests for possible cauda equina. The tests came back negative and whilst still in substantial pain (slightly more mobile) even with the all the pain treatment given, I was discharged with crutches. I was told by the nurse any other decisions such as possible surgery would have to be a "discussion to be had with a gp". I now have to go back to my GP and literally beg for surgery or contact my local MP.  
I am so disgusted and deflated due to the lack of proper diagnosis and treatment available through the NHS. It seems unless it's deemed an emergency, the only answer ever is pain relief and pain management or go private. This is not enough for me. At 34 years old I am in no position to be in this state and still be able to work the rest of my days with ineffective pain relief. Without proper treatment and just masking the issue with pain relief I will no doubt have to take myself out of work half way through my working life, and live in pain taking tablets the rest of my days. I'm a mechanic by trade, and if I was to put this into perspective, it would be like me attending a breakdown where a car has blown its engine and telling them the car is fine but it has be towed the rest of its days.  
Pain relief should be a temporary measure until a permanent fix can be found. Not a permanent measure until a permanent fix is too late.

title: Rude, obnoxious, disorganised
body: The service I have received from this practise is appalling.  Once my visit I have had medication knocked off repeat, had a text message as to why this has happened which referred to a letter I had yet to receive.  The practise manager is rude and indicates that you as the patient are the problem and that the staff are blameless.  If you want an appointment sooner than 3 weeks in advance, go somewhere else.

title: COVID 2 years wait for appointment but worth the…
body:
Unfortunately I arrived late due to full car park. Apologised as I went in, no problem receptionist said. Ask if I had sanitised and ask me to take a seat. All seating distanced. 
5 mins later called in for first part of treatment, then straight in for second part. 
All staff were polite and friendly. 
Appointment took 30 mins from arriving to leaving. 
Very impressed thank you

title: Tele service terrible
body: They need to look at there telephone system was on phone over 3/4 he to be cut of after being number one in cue then phoned back waited 25 mins before I even got to number one in cue then got told I needed to phone back on Monday as no appointment were available for two weeks how do you no that your going to be I'll in two weeks time even call back from doctor or nurse the wait was for week time

title: Menopause
body: The GPs in this practise and specially males need detailed training on perimenopause and menopause + HRT treatments. A 45 year old with every single new symptom identical to menoupausal and perimenopausal stages is not too young! I was shocked with the lack of knowledge on this area. I had to tell him what to do

title: An Amazing Practice
body: Thank You Walford Mill Practice Yet Again For Excellent Service. Saw Dr & Within 10 Day's  Fast Track Apt Had Endoscopy, Thankfully Nothing Alarming Found & Treatment Advised. I Feel Truly Blessed To Be A Patient @ This Caring Thoughtful Practice 💐

title: Trouble Free Surgery
body: I had three procedures done on my ankle on Saturday and can't praise the care at Pontefract Hospital highly enough. Everyone I came into contact with provided great service and I felt so well looked after throughout my short stay. My anaesthetist was absolutely amazing and I drifted off to sleep chatting about going on holiday to Barbados. I'd felt very anxious about the surgery but needn't have worried as the staff made sure that everything went smoothly. A big thank you to everyone who made the experience so much better than I expected.

title: Telephone Service
body:
My elderly parents have been trying to get a appointment . Since Friday .
Friday waited on the phone 3/4 of an hour no answer.
Monday waited on the phone 1 hour no answer. 
Monday at 18.15 this Evening  I tried for my ederleyparent  .
Got no answers .
What is the answer to get an appointment please.

title: Frustrating and an Obstruction to care
body:
The wait times of this surgery are ridiculous. The last two visits I have waited over an hour to be seen by the GP, only to be rushed and fobbed off when it has finally been my turn. I wouldn’t mind, but these appointments have been for my two-year old. As you can imagine, trying to keep a two-year old entertained and quiet for an hour in a busy surgery is disastrous. There is not even a hint of an apology when you are finally seen. 

There is absolutely no care or consideration for patients and it’s just like they want to go through the motions of seeing patients to get paid at the end of the day. I’m sure you’d be seen quicker going to A&E. 

Wait times like these are out of order, especially during a pandemic!! You want to be in the building for as little time as possible. 

Regret enrolling here and will be leaving for another surgery where you can actually be seen in a timely manner. You can’t get through on the phones and the message they play doesn’t even make any sense!! 

Utter waste of your time. Choose another surgery!!

title: Dependable & Reliable & Caring
body: I have throughout covid been coming up to the practice to have a procedure that needs doing every 2 months the urology trained surgical GP is the only person that can do this due to my complex case. The staff member has always been polite pleasant as others have. I felt safe & clean throughout pandemic. It’s easy to criticise I can only speak for 34 years that staff are doing there very best long hours more demands. Yes there have been a few blips in those 34 years but I always spoke to the lead gp about any staff issues who feedback etc. Staff are unique like a hca & staff nurse & admin & some old receptionists who are excelling in there jobs compassionate caring THANK YOU for being there & helping me through my complex case & conditions & not making me feel like a nuisance.

title: Top Work !
body: I was looked after and cared for in the finest way , many thanks to all the staff, patient kind and totally made me feel at ease  !

title: Wonderful  GP Practice
body: I cannot recommend highly enough the excellent care I received from my GP service recently, and particularly when they are under such pressure with the pandemic. I was seen in person, then referred promptly for hospital screening, As soon as results came in I was called personally to be kept informed. Both the GP's and the receptionists were caring and compassionate during a worrying health scare - I could not have wished for better care. Thank you.

title: Great practice
body: I cannot explain how amazing every member of staff that I had nurses docs surgens anithest where all amazing it was clean food was lovely. Always felt like they listened to me, when I had a bit of disconfort they gave me pain relief my experience with them just amazing all around cannot fault them if only all hospitals could be like the bmi. The staff should really take pride with the job they do. Didn't need to ask questions as I had all the information given to me. Just the up most respect dignity everything. Thank you to everyone that treated me jade parry..acepitble jobs you all did and continue to do.

title: AMAZING !!!
body:
I cannot thank the GP’s , Receptionist’s & nurses enough. They go above & beyond to offer the best service every day. After a recent phone call at 17:57pm to reception, I got a call back at 18.15 from the doctor for my young daughter & was seen at 08:50 the morning after. 
An amazing service , 1st class staff who always go above & beyond. Thank You !!!

title: Brilliant treatment
body:
The doctor I saw and the nurses who attended me were thorough, patient, kind and extremely sympathetic. I couldn't have wished for better care. My one negative comment is that I found the receptionists to be unhelpful and their manner appallingly distant and cold. why has, 'Hello. How can I help you? or
'What can I do for you?' disappeared? I was made to feel uncomfortable and tentative about even asking for some water. Apart from that I can only say, 'Thank you' to all the Doctor's and nursing staff for their sensitive care. A thousand stars, not just five.

title: A disgrace
body: Can't get through on phones and not one appointment online ever ! I will report this practice I have not been well and cannot see a GP for my health

author: antx
title: QEUH parking and baby scan
body:
I recently went for my first maternity ultrasound at the QEUH. Overall, I had a good experience with the care I received and was grateful to be able to have my partner there at the scan. However, there are a couple of things which made this experience less favorable.  
  
The parking at QEUH is appalling, I think everyone knows that and I appreciate it is a difficult issue to resolve. We spent at least 20 minutes in search of a space, doing laps through the multi-storey not realising the top 3 levels are for staff only, this could have been more clear. There is a simple way to improve everyone's experience - install vehicle detection sensors. Car parks all over the world use these and it makes it easy to know how many spaces are available even before you go in, it would make everyone's experience with the limited parking so much better. I am already dreading going back for my next appointment due to the parking, what would we do if I was coming to give birth and urgently needed a space?  
  
The other thing that would have improved my experience drastically is the ability to receive a video of your ultrasound. This is done extremely easily privately, and photos/videos are sent by email, reducing paper use. Why can this not be offered to women with the NHS? I do completely understand the strict instruction not to take any video, but the memory of my baby jumping in my womb is already fading and I so wish I could treasure it more. I know this is not the purpose of the appointment, I completely appreciate it is a health service but if you are able to provide a printed, surely it wouldn't be too difficult to send these by email instead and include a video? And it would save printing/paper resource? I don't imagine my suggestion will go anywhere, but in 5-10 years time I hope things like this will improve.

readBy.name: Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2021)

title: Unprofessional, uncaring, unhelpful
body: Very unprofessional. Have had a bad cough for 9 months with bleeding  and chest pains.Had a breathing test and results hadnt come for weeks. Dr requested someone to chase up. When i rang first they said theyre chasing it up. The next time they said they dont know who to ring so i should ring myself. When i rang the hospital switchboard they put me through but the hospital needed a surgery request. When i rang the surgery they said they dont know who to email so i should email the hospital to pass on the surgery email address so the hospital should contact. Im sure it wasnt that confusing to ring the hospital switchboard. They cpuld have at least tried instead if fobbing it off with " i dont know who to call." Especially when it should be on the records who ive been referred to by the gp for the test.Also this isnt the first bad experience. If you care for you health i advise you dont register here unless you want to waste your time and your health and end up annoyed.

title: Outstanding care
body:
I first visited this dept in May 2021 where every single member of staff was so friendly. I had some pretty upsetting news and their care was second to none, I was constantly checked on, made a cup of tea and the nurses, technicians and reception staff went out of their way to talk to me and help me.

I had surgery at BMEC the following day from seeing them. Was due a follow up appt a couple of days from today (day of writing review) but this morning woke up with issues. I called the unit and they said the would do what they could to get me in later this evening but in the meantime to speak to gp for medication. Go was unwilling to prescribe same medication as not an eye specialist so I called back to let them know. Within 20 minutes I had a call to say that my consultant could see me in 2 hours time.
Once again, super friendly staff, amazing care and fortunately nothing major with my problem.

I cannot thank the staff enough for their quick reactions from my first visit in May which could’ve saved my sight, and for their friendliness, professionalism and genuine care on both occasions. Thank you Machin Eye Unit, you have been amazing.

title: Some good some bad
body:
Coventry Spa Medica 100percent excellent
Central telephone service.Tel No 03300584280.Totally unfit for purpose.Unreasonable time to answer call (20mins Typical) Need more staff

author: Danielle1993
title: Amazing VBAC experience at Forth Valley Royal
body:
I recently gave birth to my beautiful boy on the AMU at Forth Valley Royal. Having had an emergency csection under general anaesthetic after a lengthy induction process in 2017, I was determined to have a different birthing experience this time round and set my heart on a VBAC.  
I was nervous about making my preferences known as I’d seen so many negative stories about health care professionals not supporting VBAC births, particularly hands off, intervention free VBACs like I was hoping for. But I needn’t have been. I contacted the head of the AMU fairly early on in my pregnancy to discuss my options and I’m so glad I did! The reaction was amazing and I felt really supported and empowered to advocate for myself to help achieve the birth I wanted which made me go into the later stages of my pregnancy feeling very confident.  
In the end, I had a beautiful VBAC water birth in the alongside midwifery unit surrounded by fairy lights. It was the most incredible and healing experience after my previous traumatic birth. All of the midwifes I met during the birth were so respectful of my wishes to follow my body’s lead and kept their distance, allowing me to birth my baby with next to no intervention or examinations etc.  
To any ladies who are reading this thinking they would like to try for a VBAC, be honest with your care team and you will be supported to have the kind of birth you want. I feel incredibly lucky to have been supported so well and still feel on cloud 9!

author: octansgk95
title: Drop-in covid jab
body:
Waited a little over an hour this morning for it to be my turn. When I got to the person giving the jab, they first called me "sir", which was slightly odd as I look nothing like a man. Looked up my info and noted that I had an appointment for this jab in a couple weeks time, questioned why I was there. Then said they had to go check on something. Came back and explained they had to see if the jab could be given as it had "only been 8 weeks", which yes...8 weeks is what we are being told is the new wait period between AZ vaccinations...hence why I was there. A remark was made about others missing out or having to wait hours in the sun which seemed to me was suggesting I was jumping the queue or somehow unfairly taking my second shot ahead of time. I thought I was doing the right thing by dropping in and freeing up my appointment slot for someone who can't drop in or stand in a queue for hours. They gave me the jab and sort of waved me towards the exit.  
I feel like the messaging people are getting from NHSGGC twitter and the website needs to either be clarified (if I was indeed in the wrong for showing up today), or the people doing the vaccinations should be kept informed of changes to the policy. The nurse was a bit rude with me and I left feeling bad, whether she was right or not.

title: No appointments
body:
My foot has been fractured but more than 10 days i couldn't make appointments I had to go to hospital.
Terrible. I have changed ny GP

title: Not great
body: My daughter was seen in AE after having severe abdominal pain. The reception staff were just rude to everyone who walked in. Communication was Terrible and staff were just miserable and rude. It really worries me thinking that if I was a patient on my own, seriously ill, I’d end up here with no one allowed to be my advocate.  I asked my daughter to find out Information about tablets she was already taking along with the ones she’d been prescribed in the hospital… she was told there was no one to see her and let her go.

readBy.name: Western Sussex Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

title: Long waiting times
body: Took my child there and the waiting times is like 4hours plus. They should make the patient aware of what the waiting times are. In this case I was not told and had to wait in a room with no windows on an extremely hot day. It was really warm that day and being the childrens a&e at least they could have cooled the place. It was soo uncomfortable sitting in that waiting room and my child was unsettled throughout. I only found out how long I’ve got to wait after enquiring from the desk. Please children a&e work on your communication with patients and please keep the waiting room cool it’s very uncomfortable to be sitting there for 4 hours plus in this hot weather.

author: warmrd77
title: Excellent Care
body: I am so grateful to the Ambulance service, A& E, AMU and especially Tilgate Annex for the care I received with breathing problems. My stay in ESH was professional and caring in challenging times. The only downside was the air conditioning in our bay was not working and for patients with chest problems was not good. All The staff were brilliant in extremely hot conditions, let's hope it is fixed soon.

readBy.name: Surrey and Sussex Healthcare NHS Trust
South East Coast Ambulance Service NHS Foundation Trust

author: Patient21
title: Ambulance crew
body:
After having ongoing chest pain I was being transferred to hospital Via Ambulance -the crew came to my home were polite and considerate. They gained consent and kept me informed of everything they were doing. I didn’t feel I warranted an ambulance transfer however they made me realise that what I was experiencing wasn’t normal and the safest way was for them to transport.  
On the journey in treatment was no different they were person centered and reassuring. These guys do a lot and i really appreciate them. So Thank you Dale (Paramedic), Tony (Ambulance technician) and Wendy (RGU paramedic student) you were amazing.

author: yellowsf37
title: Great care from Early Pregnancy Assessment Clinic
body:
I received excellent care from Ninewells Early Pregnancy Assessment Clinic (EPAC) last week after experiencing bleeding in early pregnancy.  
Continuity of care was brilliant - I spoke with the same lovely midwife (Sarah) by telephone on two days and then came in for a face-to-face appointment with her on the third day. She was reassuring, compassionate, knowledgeable and very personable, putting both myself and my partner at ease.  
I was given the opportunity to make important decisions about my own care.

author: zebrakx66
title: Implant removal and exchange
body:
I attended for contraceptive implant removal/exchange.  
Walking in I was really nervous, but the staff were absolutely lovely, kept me calm. I felt no pain!

author: coinfj49
title: Getting a coil fitted
body:
Requested an appointment for ASAP to get the coil fitted as emergency contraception but also with the intention of having it as a long term contraceptive.  
The doctor was really nice and even stayed over to ensure I could get the service I needed on the day. The nurse helping him did the same too and they were both very helpful, friendly, made sure I was comfortable and asked if I needed any questions answering.  
Very good experience.

author: Marpm83
authorRole: a staff member posting for a carer/relative
title: Carers Week
body:
I was contacted by Deirdre (at the hospice) for Carers week and it could have not come at the right time. I was given options of treatments and was booked in for a massage. I was welcomed by Jo who is very experienced in her field and asked me what I wanted from this massage and the areas of concern. As I manually handle my mum my concerns were my arms and back and tension in the neck. Jo delivered the most fantastic, relaxing massage adhering to all my concerns: thank you Jo and all the team for what you do for carers. I  
left relaxed and valued - thank you.

author: Oksana
title: Breast care
body: Staff didn't pay attention to my problem. And told that is normal to have pain and lumps in breast.

readBy.name: Northern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Daftie 62
title: Growth removal
body:
I was assessed by Nurse Gillian & Lesley.  
They discussed doing a punch biopsy to remove the growth  
Lesley thoroughly explained the procedure and what I should expect.  
She performed my surgery, assisted by Gillian and I was totally amazed that I barely felt even her touch.  
Both the nurses were professional and so lovely  
They made me feel so at ease and confident with their practice.

title: Unresponsive
body: The website says to call to book. You call and get 'we are now closed. Phone lines are open Monday to Friday, 9am to 5pm' despite it being 12 noon on a Tuesday. I've called and the phone has been ringing upwards of 3 hours today and last week. Nobody ever picks up the phone. Was like this before covid too. Not even a case of 'no appointments' - nobody will answer my call to tell me when appointments are. Far too many sources have conflicting information, and phone lines seem to be unmanned.

readBy.name: Central and North West London Mental Health NHS Foundation Trust

title: go somewhere else
body: why is it always the patient doing the chasing up for results. Over an hour I spent waiting to talk to someone, just under a month I've been waiting to hear if I have a dodgy heart or not, probably something that should be made aware of as the new medication I have been prescribed can cause more heart problems. And I'm still waiting the doctor hasn't looked at my results yet. I understand that covid is slowing everything down and there is a backlog and there are people in worse situations than this but why is it so slow.

title: Not answering phone for 2 hours
body: I've tried more than a dozen times today [14/06/21] to contact reception between 12:50 and 14:55 including 2 waits of 20 minutes. There were a couple of times when the line was busy and call dropped, otherwise 'on hold'.  I also tried to fill out a form which was apparently 'time locked to this morning at 8am'. So that was a no go. Still trying to get through on phone .....

title: Excellent care at breast clinic
body: I'm so grateful for the professional and expert care I received at my first visit to the breast clinic at St. James'.  It is such a busy unit but all the staff treated me with kindness and patience, giving me information about my situation at every stage.  Words can't express my thanks and appreciation for having access to the one of the best free medical care facilities in Europe.

title: “Ice House” by name,  ice house by nature?
body:
I was hoping their move to a new site, might be a fresh start for this recently poorly-rated surgery,  but feel truly disappointed after today’s visit.
I was one of 3 patients, all with pre-booked appts., waiting to be admitted into the building. We had rung the doorbell, and the receptionist eventually peered through the glass, saw us, but disappeared again.
Several minutes later we were asked to identify ourselves via the intercom and the receptionist opened the door, allowing the first patient to enter. Although I was quite obviously already holding my mask and starting to put it on, the receptionist snapped at me “and YOU can be putting your mask on while you wait”, and shut the door in my face.
We were told to sit facing the video screen in the waiting area, and to keep watching it constantly, because it would give us instructions of when and where to go for our appointment. We were all sitting there, intently watching the screen, so that we would catch the few seconds when each of our appointments appeared on the screen, (take your eyes off for a few seconds, and you’d miss it).
In the meantime, the screen shows advice about mental health issues and what we should/shouldn’t be eating etc. Fair enough maybe, but you are compelled to watch, in order not to miss your appt. whist, to add to the subliminal effect, repetitive, almost hypnotic, “music” was playing,  so that every patient I saw was staring blankly at the screen, uniformly tapping their feet to the tuneless computerised beat.
I felt like we were a group of robots, and it was a relief when my instructions appeared on the screen, and I followed the arrows in the austere and characterless corridors and stairs to the designated room.
Fortunately, the nurse was kind, friendly and proficient, so I felt reasonably human again.
Yes, I know that Covid restrictions are preventing normal interactions, and perhaps this is particularly true (and necessary) in a medical setting, but there is surely no excuse for rudeness, and not treating patients respectfully, and as individuals.

title: Hard working team under very busy circumstances
body: We had to attend A&E on a Monday afternoon due to my 6 year old son fracturing his wrist. When we walked in, it was so busy! However we were seen by triage within about 5 minutes and x rayed within 45 mins. We then had to wait some time for the Dr to see him but we were done with a plaster cast on within 3.5 hours. Whilst this may not sound particularly quick, the department was extremely busy and the staff were all excellent, apologising for the delay which they really didn't need to. They were clearly working hard under difficult circumstances and I hope this review reaches anyone working the afternoon of 14.06.21, thank you!

title: Would not recommend
body:
The communication with this practice needs improving. Telephone communication is extremely poor and can be rude at times.
Would not recommend

title: Great Experience
body: I was absolutely terrified going in for a very minor op under general anaesthetic. All the staff I spoke to did their best to reassure me and calmed me down, they really are a credit to the service.

title: Absolutely awful
body: Felt like a burden, when was in pain all I got in response is "really!?". Comments of nurses leaving staff room "I don't care, everyone's leaving anyways!" weren't very reassuring for patients after surgery!

title: Telephone lines are far too busy
body:
I have received  two letters now asking me to book my cervical screening appointment. But I haven't been able to get through to reception to book them. I held for 45 minutes and had to give up due to other commitment's and the end of my lunch break. I worry people could end up really sick because they can't book online either.

When I have actually spoke with a doctor they are always understanding and helpful I Just wish it could be easier
 I used to use the online form but this only available during surgery hours now too

title: Dreadful patient care
body: 3 phone calls - in total 2.5 hours on the phone - mainly on hold and still not been able to secure an appointment despite a text from them asking me to make one!

title: Friendly practice
body: Have been with the surgery for many years and appreciate the high level of cate that my doctor has provided me with over the years. Highly recommended practice.

title: Rude
body: After waiting for 1 hour and 10 minutes to get through on the appointment line.  I needed to know whether I needed to contact them or the hospital.  The receptionist would not acknowledge what a consultant had already told me because it wasn't in writing.  As she didn't understand she then blamed me and said I had unclear speech and said it would be better to read out of hours report instead.  She did and then directed me to ring the hospital.  What a waste of time and the rudeness is uncalled for.

title: A waste of NHS funding
body: The doctor refuses to follow the NHS Consultants request for repeat prescriptions. The receptionist won't allow you to make an appointment. When asked for a refusal of treatment and appointment get sent a text message (how rude!) with a male doctor even though they know it is connected to a more personal area, so cancelled the appointment. I  will now need a more expensive trip back to the consultant because GPs won't be GPs

title: extremely professional
body:
i was very please to be seen by the HAPI - Hand and Plastic Injury Clinic.
i had extermly good care from the Doctor.the Doctor took time to explain what was going to happen
and the nursing team were very  reassuring

title: Excellent care
body: My son had an accident this evening (14th June) (fell from a 7ft wall) and hurt his wrists and foot. The accident and emergency dept was clearly very busy with a full waiting room. We expected a wait. But we were triaged, xrayed, reviewed and sent home all within an hour. All staff from our nurse in navy, to the radiologists and the Dr in red were so kind and efficient. My son wanted to say thank you and of course so did I.

readBy.name: Royal Devon University Healthcare NHS Foundation Trust

author: Marie012
title: First class service
body: My 14 year old son sustained a bad fracture to his arm. He was in extreme pain and we were worried about a long wait to be assessed but he was taken straight to resus by the nursing sister and given immediate pain relief. Assessed quickly by the consultant and his fracture reduced. Huge thank you to all the fantastic staff who are working under difficult conditions but they still managed to be extremely friendly and professional. First class service!

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: novemberjh87
title: A well-oiled machine
body:
I felt great pride in regards to having a free health service that despite having the word free in the title, provides a level of care and dedication that is rarely seen in a service that is not focused on profit.  
The whole process was, as the old cliche goes "a well-oiled machine" I even liked the 10-15 minute wait afterwards, as it takes into account that everyone is different. I did not even feel the injection go in and was in and out within 20 minutes and that includes the post care.

author: cygnussh77
title: I was dreading the procedure
body: Had a colonoscopy today at Queen Margaret Hospital Dunfermline. I was really dreading this procedure but I must say it was the best procedure I had ever had from start to finish. The staff in the endoscopy unit are amazing so friendly and helpful really put me at ease. The doctor who did the procedure was great she listened to my worries and I must say it was the 1st time in over maybe 20 of those I was able to watch on the screen what was happening. I normally have to have a lot of sedation but today I managed with about half of what I usually get and only once or twice felt a little discomfort. The tea and toast that followed was much needed. Overall a great experience.

author: November66
title: Eating disorder
body: Worried about my teenage daughter and spoke to my GP on Monday and she was seen assessed by CAMHS that week. Very impressed with the speed, professionalism and caring approach to both me and my daughter. Can’t thank them enough although we are just at the start of our recovery journey.

author: hippobj54
title: Sexual health clinic
body:
Appointment with Amanda and Sacha. The loveliest people! Was very nervous to come in but they made me feel so welcome, they were very understanding.
Thank you so much!

title: Telephone appointment
body: apparently the doctor was very put out by a telephone appointment. I tried to make an in person to discuss multiple issues but was told the doctor would call. She didn't seem to appreciate this was a consultation and began the phone call with "I was told to call you", it was extremely unhelpful and she only helped with the most extremely urgent issues - which required making hospital appointment. disappointed with the service.

title: Don't keep their word
body: I have my younger 2 children on my system online. My child's blood results were not showing so I phoned and the receptionist told me the results, I queried with her why the results are not showing she said they will be on know. Furthermore, my daughter got taken off, last year because she turned 12. Couple days later I visited the surgery I spoke to the receptionist he said she shouldn't have been taken off and he will get her back on. Still my sons blood test are not showing and neither is my daughter back on.

title: Lack of professionalism
body: I was meant to be assessed within 20 minutes of registering. It took them 1 hour and a half instead. That delayed my visit even longer and was left agonizing in pain without any pain killers or anything to help.

author: T Gardener
title: Returning to work
body: Future Positive is well named. My employment adviser has given me the confidence to explore the possibility of setting up my own business. This is something I’ve always wanted to do but my mental health condition was a huge barrier. The practical help and encouragement I have received have made the prospect less daunting and now I believe it is achievable.

title: Couldn't make this up
body: I've waited over 12 months for an op, only to be told ON THE DAY when I arrived that they could not let me in because I used THEIR staff/patient shuttle bus to get there. Apparently I needed to use the resources of a taxi or a private ambulance thing just to bring me in. Now I dont know when the op will be, and its put all my plans, childcare and work into complete chaos. Staff and other patients on the same bus were free to roam, even one patient infront of me lied and said they came in a car and guess what, they got let through. But me being honest obviously backfired on me. I cannot comprehend the double standards and the lack of understading

readBy.name: Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2021)

title: Amazing staff, courteous  caring calm and…
body: My son was seen very quickly in Urgent Care, the nurse was friendly and knowledgeable and explained everything clearly. He was treated quickly and given dressings to ensure he could continue to treat the condition effectively at home. Thank you for wonderful service

author: Lauren1999
title: Very knowledgeable
body: I feel very reassured because I was very nervous with covid 19 about seeing a nurse but from the very beginning, I was reassured the receptionist was very hygienic and asked me politely to change my mask and sanitise my hands and felt like it was a pleasant experience. Caroline the nurse was lovely and very knowledgeable.

author: julypr35
title: Lovely staff
body: I got an implant! Amanda and Sasha, were very friendly which helped to calm my nerves a lot. Explained all the options and went to extra lengths to ensure I didn’t have any pain. Overall, it was a really good experience.

author: Marmite love it or hate it
title: I went for my covid 19 second vaccination
body:
I sat down in the chair and the doctor proceeded to inject my left arm. -Oh dear-or words to that effect this needle is empty. So he reached for a second needle and injected my left arm again. While I was sat in my chair a few moments later a nurse of doctor came across and said to the doctor-I saw you put a used needle back in the tray with the full needles-. He replied very hesitantly that that was earlier when he did not have a sharps box, so I used a tray. I did not believe this for one minute as every station had a sharps box and a spare one under the table. I went home in pieces thinking what has this doctor just given me. My best friend is currently dying a slow agonising death with only months to live because of liver disease brougt on by hepatitis. So I fully understand the implications of catching hepatitis or even HIV from a dirty needle.  
I rang my doctors on the following Monday 2 days after my incident and spoke to the practice manager telling her what had gone on and could I have a blood test to make sure I hadn’t caught anything. She said they would treat it as a needle stick incident and arrange a blood test and hepatitis vaccine . I felt a little bit safer knowing things were in place to help protect me.  
The next day a GP from my practice rang me and I was cast into a whole world of hell. She said they could not do the blood tests and vaccination, I asked her why and she replied. -we can’t do the blood test just like that because it did not happen!”! I said what do you mean it did not happen I was given two needles. She said she could not trace the person that witnessed the doctor put the dirty needle back in with the ready to use ones. I said speak to your practice manager she knows who it was. She said again I could not have a blood test and vaccination as they could not be done for no reason. She said all I could do was have a meeting with the dr concerned. I said I don’t want to see him again as he would be the last person on earth I would want to see and talk to. That’s all we can do she said so I said ok but I am not happy.  
The following day the practice manager rang me to say the insurance company had been in touch and to put my mind at rest they’d would do the blood test and vaccination.  
I went along to my local sexual health clinic and took my place in the waiting room. My name was called and I went into an exam room with a nurse who’s calming manner instantly put me at ease. She totally understood my concerns and worries and took time to explain about the whole process. She then went on to take my initial blood test asking if I also wanted to be checked for HIV. The thought of George Michael and Freddie Mercury came straight into my head. What if the person whose needle I got had aids as well as hepatitis. A double death sentence.  
She then gave me my initial vaccination for hepatitis and made my follow up monthly appointments for more vaccine and finally a blood test to see if I had contracted hepatitis or HIV.  
Four weeks later I got summoned to the clinic as my blood test had shown no antibodies to the hepatitis so I would g go ave to have the monthly vaccine shots. So My life was now in the lap of the gods. Hoping the vaccine got into my bloodstream and built up antibodies before anything nasty did.I have another vaccine shot in June then my final blood test to see if I am clear or infected in august.  
I feel like a dirty person and have not kissed or had any sexual relationship with my wife since. I cannot sleep at night as I lie awake thinking what if!!!!!!I find myself crying when I am alone and get suicidal thoughts. Why me I find myself saying, what have I done to deserve thiS. The words -it didn’t happen-reverberate around inside my head. In dec 2019 I had a right leg below knee amputation and because of covid getting a prosthetic was delayed. I finally got my leg but rather than being out there practising I find myself in bed trying to catch up on sleep as I can’t sleep at night anymore. My best friend with 3 or 4 months to live at best is eating away at me to. Thank you cobridge sexual health clinic for all you have done and for being a good listener.  
What the outcome will be I do not know

readBy.name: Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2021)

author: EmilySchoppler
title: Maternity unit
body: I would like to thank everyone at the Borders General hospital maternity unit for the most amazing care throughout my birth/postnatal care. I would like to specifically mention midwife Libby and student midwife Pamela who looked after us throughout my labour. My husband and Mum were my birthing partners and were absolutely amazing but I couldn't have done it without the support and guidance of those staff members. They were honestly the best!!! I absolutely owe my positive birth experience to you guys. Thank you so so much. Also the girls in ward 16 who looked after me on my first night in with my daughter they were so supportive and helped me adjust to mum life.

author: normazy46
title: Excellent nursing care after surgery
body: I came in for surgery and I was very anxious. After coming out of surgery I was looked after by an excellent nurse (Isobel) in the Day Surgery ward who made sure my pain was well managed and helped ease some of that anxiety. I was discharged the same day but remember how safe I felt under her care.

author: Ferrer
title: Employment support
body: Phil has been by far the most useful aspect of the support I have had from the nhs in my recovery over recent years. Incredibly competent and no-nonsense while totally accepting and validating.

author: Lunabeans21
title: Mum and Visitors
body:
Mum was admitted and isolated for 7 days due to COVID-19.  
When I phoned, was told it HAD to be same visitors every time.  
I go to various supermarkets, queue in the post office, am fully vaccinated... But can’t see Mum in a visitor room? Makes no sense whatsoever to me!  
It’s disgusting… Mum is in her 80's, never been in this position before and is highly distressed.  
Can anyone explain why?

author: triangulumbx35
title: Maternity services
body: The staff seemingly refuse to be held accountable and refuse to give access to a consultant. They told me that they would call you back and then didn't. It seems to me that anxiety and mental health needs requiring empathy are not a priority for them, staff wearing PPE in hot weather was given higher priority than an expectant mother who is having panic attacks and hyperventilating.

readBy.name: University Hospitals of North Midlands NHS Trust

author: Alwyn1315
title: Biopsy procedure
body: Well today I went in for biopsy procedure at northwick park hospital and I was so so scared as it was my ever 1st in my life. So I was meet with very best of doctor's there and nurses aswell I asked them hell lot of questions but they didn't even became upset. I want to thank the doctors and nurses involved today with my biopsy. Special shout out to Naomi, she held my hand all along. She was like an angel. Thank you all so much.

readBy.name: London North West University Healthcare NHS Trust

author: SuperL123
title: Eating disorder service
body:
Following some issues I was having with Eating Disorders and Mental Health I was referred for treatment at the Nottinghamshire Eating Disorder Service at the Mandala Centre. My initial consultation took place in person at the centre which is where I first met my therapist, following this there was a very long wait (a few months) before I was actually offered treatment. I began my treatment in person and was immediately struck by the fact I was struggling to express myself in the sessions due to the therapist constantly talking at me, or interrupting when I was explaining in response to a question. I continued the sessions as I was hopeful that this was just the initial phase of treatment and that I would get more chance to discuss my issues further down the line. This however, was not the case. When the lockdown came into effect my sessions were transferred to a telephone conversation service. At this point the therapist began arriving late to sessions, often between 15-30 minutes after the time our call was scheduled. Some weeks I would be waiting for the call for our appointment and the call would never come. I was never given any explanation or apology for this, they would just turn up to the following week's session as though nothing had occurred.  
One of the main issues I had was that the therapist didn’t take my opinions into account, particularly concerning my ongoing treatment. I felt I was not ready to be discharged from the service but there was a continual pressure for me to do so. The therapist kept bringing this up in our sessions and eventually texted me to tell me that I was being discharged from the service despite my wishes. In the message it was explained that the reason for this being that there was pressure from management due to an extensive waiting list. I feel this is an unacceptable reason to discharge someone still in need of support.  
Overall I feel the lack of care and poor communication has really affected my experience and that the delivery of this type of service should be monitored more closely. I still feel that I am struggling with issues I really need support with. I would like more therapy with a different practitioner, but have now been discharged from the service and am unsure what my options are.

author: Camilla17
title: First vaccine
body: Everything was smooth, staff was extremely kind, caring and professional.

author: MelissaWM
title: Covid 19 vaccination
body: I just want to say thank you so much to all the wonderful staff at the John Scott Vaccination Centre! They’re doing an incredible job running the vaccine operations and I felt completely safe the entire process. Thank you to Aysha who inoculated me, she was incredibly positive and professional. This whole thing has really given me a lot of hope and I’m really grateful to all the volunteers for putting themselves at risk for the greater good! You’re all wonderful. Thank you.

author: Ke14405
title: Covid vaccine
body: Very well organised, everyone was fab, especially June who did my vaccine, thank you very much

readBy.name: Royal Devon University Healthcare NHS Foundation Trust

author: JoJo86
title: Reassuring and very informative
body:
Visited the Women's Health clinic yesterday at Pilgrim Hospital for a colposcopy, and to say I was anxious was an understatement.  
However, the 3 ladies who were with me, Miss Rao, Tracy and Janet, were absolutely amazing. They were very calming, reassuring and very informative. They really put me at ease and made the whole process a lot easier to deal with.  
Thank you so much ladies!!

author: NTM21
title: Saved my life
body:
This experience has more than just saved my life from the accident but also from a very bad addiction. I woke up in the Royal Hospital major trauma unit in Belfast not knowing much on what happened at first until it had been explained a few time by Doctors and nurses. I was in severe pain not able to even hold a conversation at the start I remember just thinking in my head I’d never be right again.  
Lucky as I was to have AMAZING staff to help me get through everyday I was here I finally started to see hope for myself in this time of excruciating pain. Day by day together I have made if so far from where I was and I’m now I’m in positive mind-state that I will now be returning home to my family and wee son who turns one soon! I would like to also thank them for the understanding of my situation and having no judgment on me and just being there to talk to about other problems I had before the accident this team of Doctors,nurses,surgeons Saved me in every way possible they have made my future look brighter and better if I ever met a hero in person it’s definitely use guys for me each and everyone that helped throughout these dark times I can never thank use all enough 😇 wish use all a the best of health and joy life can give in the future 😇

readBy.name: Belfast Health and Social Care Trust
Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2021)

author: Neurotic asthma patient
title: Day surgery excellent care
body:
I can’t thank the team in the day surgery unit enough not only for their excellent care, but their support with my fear about something going wrong.  
They arranged for me to be awake during surgery with a nerve block. The anaethetist team were exceptional and kept me fully I formed all the way through.  
All of the staff ensured my dignity was maintained at all times. They also gave me a few laughs along the way!Excellent service, and amazing staff.

readBy.name: Royal Devon University Healthcare NHS Foundation Trust

author: Pipsqueak132
title: Awful experience at A&E
body:
My mum was recently given her second covid vaccine and unfortunately had a severe allergic reaction to this and it caused facial swelling (to the point her eyes couldn't open) as well as red, raised itchy rash. We had been seen at A&E on Sunday after speaking to 111 and was given antihistamines, Tuesday mum got worse so we took her to her GP where they told us to immediately come back to A&E for treatment.  
Now A&E staff were excellent and truly cared about my mum however the security staff were horrendous! My mum suffers with anxiety, depression and borderline personality disorder along with other health issues and on the door I explained to security I am mums sole carer and I need to be with her due to her anxiety. They simply said that they know what anxiety looks like and that my mum doesn't have it. After further explaining yes she does they went on to say she will have to "suck it up" as I would not be going in with her. With 6 years in healthcare professions I truly understand the reason they are controlling the amount of people in and out of the hospital due to the pandemic. Yet to be told by a secure guard mum doesn't have anxiety and she will have to suck it up was disgraceful, I have spoken to the on call manager that night who explained I should have been allowed in and that it should have been a nurse to make the call if my mum needed me or not. It took an hour and a half of fighting to get inside to be with my mum in that time she had seen a nurse and a doctor but because she was so flustered by the event she had no recollection of this!  
As it turns out the nurse said I was allowed in the waiting area with mum but not in the triage space due to it being so busy. This was absolutely fine as it allowed me to be there when mum came out to calm her down and ensure she understood what was happening with her care.  
My mum was admitted that night and I spoke daily with her to ensure she was ok and that she understood things however it added a lot more stress onto an already stressful event. My main takeaway from this is that Treliske currently have security on the doors for a completely viable reason however if you are patient-facing and have the task to decide who can and cannot enter you should have the basic knowledge in mental health disorders to know the true impact you can have with your words.  
If mum had come home that night I knew she would have needed a lot of emotional support to ensure she didn’t believe the incident to be her fault which may have put her at risk of self harm as a result.  
One person's words can have dire consequences on an already vulnerable person.  
I will now be personally seeing what my small voice can do to ensure no matter who you are if you are working on hospital grounds and patient-facing that basic mental health knowledge is taught, this goes for all staff from cleaners, security to maintenance!

readBy.name: Plymouth University Health and Human Sciences students, 2018

author: FANTAZZZ
title: Coming from nothing to something
body: I was homeless for 7 yrs and rock bottom was suicidal n without hope. if it wernt for cgl i would be dead, they believed in me and gave me the hope thanks to them all, selena, andrea n steve I've now got my own home & life & thanks to christina too. they don't get enough credit for all the great work they do.

author: Yaiyai
title: Recent surgery
body:
At my CT scan, where the problem of a large cyst was discovered, the radiologist was so kind when I said I was worried and did everything to make me feel confident about the process and offered me options about my infusion  
At my gynaecologist appointment Kirsty, who I know from outside the hospital setting, immediately asked if I was comfortable with her being the nurse at my appointment, I was as she’s such a lovely person who I trust, and she and Drs Dutton and Tomlinson, couldn’t have been nicer and more professional.  
From my admission until I left I was treated with kindness and respect. As a very nervous patient they couldn’t have done more to make me feel safe. I consider myself very fortunate to have had such prompt attention at the hospital and feel very appreciative of their professionalism and care.

author: AQuinn
title: Kindness and support
body: I was admitted with diverticulitis and I was so, so ill. I was a nervous patient and was so scared. I was received with care kindness and support, everyone immediately put me at ease. I would like to thank all the nurses on the ward, especially Leah, Aliasha, Heather, and Laura, HCA's Amanda, Nicola, and Lauren their caregiving and communication efficiency was second to none. The wonderful funny and fantastic consultant Mr. Shaban and his wonderful team, Greg, Jack, Oli were all fantastic and understanding I felt listened to and part of the decision-making at every step of the way. Their bedside manner was amazing, they put me at ease, and cared for me really well. Nothing was a bother. A very big thank you to everyone x

title: Wonderful GP Surgery
body:
I am a newly registered patient at the vale surgery. 
The registration process was so quick and easy. 
The reception staff are very kind, caring and helpful. I have met one of the GPs so far and he has been very professional and attentive to my medical needs. The Health Care Assistant was very supportive and she did my blood test for me. I had a medication review and received my prescription on the same day that I had a telephone consultation with the GP. The prescription was sent electronically to my local pharmacy within a matter of minutes. It has been so easy to make an appointment and I congratulate the team for being so organised and well managed. I would definitely recommend this GP surgery to my friends and family. Keep up the good the vale surgery team! Thank you for your kind support.

title: Thorough and helpful
body: I visited the physiotherapist and they made adjustments for my impairment, did a thorough examination, explained everything clearly and carefully and was froenfly and approachable.

title: Reception staff
body: I have never had a cause for complaint regarding the treatment I have received at this practice, however the reception and office staff are woefully lacking in customer service and are using the pandemic to deliver an even greater lack of service. I am sure the GPS would be embarrassed if they knew the level of service that was being delivered by their staff.  You get members of the team once had a professional manner but even they have now adopted the same abrupt and rude tone.

title: Exceptional care
body: I have been registered with several surgeries around the country but I have never experienced the level of care I have had while registered with Greystoke. From the receptionists, to the practice nurse, to the midwives and the GPs. Everyone I have been in contact with has bent over backwards to help and has treated me and my family with respect, good humour, compassion and genuine concern. I know that I can rely on them to care for me and my family when I really need them, even at very short notice. They have provided exceptional care during the most difficult of times and I and my family are grateful.

title: Great Physiotherapist
body:
Spoke to a physiotherapist yesterday on the phone regarding a 2 year groin tear. She fully understood and diagnosed my condition within minutes despite it being over 2 years.

Very very got physiotherapist. They need to be given to correct information from General practitioners though to avoid time wasting
